com.radirius.mercury.graphics

Class Texture

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.radirius.mercury.graphics.Texture
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Resource, Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SubTexture

    public class Texture
extends Object
implements Resource
    An object version of a texture. This will store the width and height of the object.
    Author:
    wessles, Jeviny

      Texture(int textureId, int width, int height, BufferedImage bufferedImage, ByteBuffer buffer)

      • Texture

        public Texture(int textureId,
       int width,
       int height,
       BufferedImage bufferedImage,
       ByteBuffer buffer)
        Make a texture of the textureId, with a width and height, based off of BufferedImage bufferedImage
        Parameters:
        textureId - The id of the texture
        width - The width of the texture
        height - The height of the texture
        bufferedImage - The source of the image, the BufferedImage
        buffer - The original buffer

            int height)
        Parameters:

        height - The height of the Texture Returns Whether the Texture has power-of-two sides

      • setExpandToPowerOfTwo

        public static void setExpandToPowerOfTwo(boolean expandToPoT)
        Sets whether or not all Textures will be expanded to the nearest power of two. Keep in mind before you change this that PoT Textures allow for faster rendering time.

      • isRepeatable

        public boolean isRepeatable()
        Returns If the Texture is PoT and not a SubTexture (and in turn, can repeat).
